website_summaries.verdict: An affordable iron that delivers even heat and comes with a variety of soldering essentials.
pros: Iron heats up fast and evenly
Comes with a 60-watt, 110-volt iron with an adjustable temperature range of 200 to 450 degrees Celsius
Comes with five tips, a stand, anti-static tweezers, and a few other soldering tools
cons: Some buyers say this iron doesn't get hot enough, while others report that it dies quickly
Power cord is a little short

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t use this for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I did not use this for its intended purpose, so I almost didn’t write a review. That being said this did exactly what I needed it for, it was easy to use for someone like me (who really didn’t have the faintest idea of how it worked). I used it to melt plastic for ventilation on my tarantula enclosures, and I even used it to attach fake plastic plants in an enclosure for them to climb on.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Superb for price, just stay next to the wall outlet.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this solder to fix wires, repurpose old diodes, and meld small prieces of plastic. It has been helpful for small household jobs. The tempurature control is also superb and extremely helpful. However, I have to dock a star because of two major issues: Some units have a light or hiss that indicates use and this has neither. The biggest problem, however, is that the unit will not stay plugged firmly into the wall outlet. Any slight touch will displace the plug, thus my previous complaint. Thus, I typically have to stay next to the outlet in order to use this device. But overall, I'm more than satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Cartoonywolf

customer_reviews.title: It's hot!! Don't drop it in your lap
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on the soldering iron before I bought it. Most of them said the retaining nut that holds the tips breaks. I recommend plugging the iron in and letting it heat up to the hottest temperature for several minutes then turn it off let it cool and the nut will come right off. This is a decent inexpensive soldering iron and works very well for quick jobs
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Pannullo

customer_reviews.title: Made me snap out of Frustrations and wasn't able to Desolder the Joystick off my xbox one controller
customer_reviews.text: Update: i've gotten good at doing this now. Back then I didn't have the tools to disassemble the whole controller. The Soldering guns is only good at soldering but not Good at Desoldering. I've had a really hard time removing the joysticks off the circuit board. It made me so mads the I've broke the controller out of frustration. After 6 hours of trying to Desolder with the Solder sucker which helped more then the Wicks. I'm a beginner at Desoldering. I've went 6 hours trying to keep it cool until I've snaps out of Frustrations. If you not highly stilled at this don't attempted it with this soldering Iron.
customer_reviews.author: Ra Drumba

customer_reviews.title: 1248 solder joints later and it still works!
customer_reviews.text: I changed all the key switches on my mechanical keyboard with this kit. 2 for the switch and 4 for the RBG LED so 624 joints to desolders and 624 to re-solder. Everything has held up well. I ran out of the included solder after 100 switches but thats because I used the solder to aid with some de-soldering. All in all, this is a great set! Sidenote, you'll have to tape the solder sucker because it likes to come loose but thats expected at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jed Ernest Josef Dela Cruz

customer_reviews.title: love this kit.  struggled for years and it seems like my old iron just did not get up to temp
customer_reviews.text: My old iron gave me trouble all the time. I followed every tutorial but had crappy results. I finally gave up and bought a kit in a last attempt to at least be functional in fixing small circuits. I wish i had thrown away my old iron years ago. sometimes I guess you can blame the tool. This kit is a nice place to start or in my case, restart.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan E.

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this soldering iron to replace batteries for gameboy games and mod some handheld consoles. After reading several reviews and blogs online, this one was recommend on 9/10 websites. The tip heats up fast, easy to control temperature, comes with all the essentials, and it’s offered at a great price. I recommend this product, and would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Very Dangerous piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Very Dangerous piece of garbage. After two test solders, the metal heating shaft melted the cheap plastic/rubber holder in the gun and fell off, exposing the heating element. The red hot tip burned my table but could have just as easily started a fire. There is no way this piece of garbage was ever UL tested or approved. I would give this product a minus 5 star rating as it could have severely injured me or started a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle not firmly attached
customer_reviews.text: First thing I did with this iron is attempt to remove and change tip. When I tried to unscrew the metal ring holding tip, the plastic part turned. I could detect the wires inside twisting so didn't turn it much. With two pairs of pliers I was able to remove the metal ring and change tip. The loose plastic part had threads, but in trying to tighten I could again detect the wires inside twisting. Felt like the wires inside would break if I turned it too much. Ended up epoxying the loose part. OK now, but poor QC. One other joke - the packaging says it's grounded, but it only has a two-prong plug.
customer_reviews.author: TOM B.

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This kit has just about everything you'll need for light to moderate electronic soldering. Unlike some other very inexpensive kits, the quality here seems decent. A big highlight is the iron itself - it's got decent medium wattage, and importantly an adjustable temperature control knob. I also liked that it has a light to indicate when it is on, and a set of alternate tips that can be easily swapped in (once it cools down!). The included solder, tweezers, solder pump etc are all useful additions, but the one item missing in this kit is a good tip-cleaning brass wire sponge. I purchased the excellent "Hakko 599B-02 Wire-type soldering iron tip cleaner" here on Amazon to complete my set.
customer_reviews.author: Mondoman

customer_reviews.title: nice little unit
customer_reviews.text: I've always sucked at soldering but this little unit gets nice and hot, melts the solder perfectly and heats up the soldering piece. It comes with solder with flux core and a stand. It also comes with tweezers and extra tips. I was very surprised to see that it even came with a solder sucker for those guys who work on circuit boards. It works great . I hope it lasts a while. Everything is great about this little unit So longevity is the factor left.
customer_reviews.author: Steve T

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an affordable soldering iron to fix a few wires so I tried this kit out. I love how affordable this kit is and all the attached heads for the iron, but the stand is very cheap, I was worried it might fall over, and the iron was coming apart from the handle so I returned it. If you need something in a pinch, this will do, but if you want something to keep for awhile, I say spend a little more on another kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny N

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Soldering Iron
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice when it comes to soldering and this thing is really straight forward. Super easy to figure out how to use it. Comes with a few different tips. Just make sure you tin the tip when using it for the first time. I just wrapped solder around the tip and then plugged it in. Comes with everything you need including some solder. I wish it would have came with some flux but it's still a really good value. Has temp control. The only thing I don't like is that the temps are in degree C. But either way it still works and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: f
customer_reviews.text: Terrible......good lord.....the rubber on the gun handle melted the first time i used it......the solder sucker is horrible the tip melted first time i used it also....the stand is cheap. I understand you get what you pay for but good lord! I actually got a replacment from them a while ago and the replacement was worse then the original.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This kit is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This little kit works very good. The iron has good heat and warms up quick. The tip size and wattage are perfect for electronics repair. I have used it on many electronic projects and it does a good job every time. I have used many high end soldering stations and this iron solders just as good. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: This, for the price, is a very impressive soldering iron. I was not expecting much, but I ordered it for my brother initially, who does not solder very often. After I used his, I ordered a second for myself. I haven't had it long enough to speak of longevity, but my initial reaction is buy this one instead of getting a cheapie from the hardware store, especially for smaller electronics work.
customer_reviews.author: Fenix8452

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to change USB port in a portable speaker I don’t know a lot about soldering. Seemed to work great. Used the solder vac and it worked great. Don’t know how long the kit would work with frequent use but for what I need it worked great
customer_reviews.author: ralfy

customer_reviews.title: great for projects
customer_reviews.text: One of the biggest complaints I saw was that the tips would break. I tested all mine out, and they all seem plenty sturdy. Being as they are modular, even if you got one that was a factory defect, the company would PROBABLY be willing to just ship you a replacement for the part that breaks, that way you can keep using it while you wait. Other than that, it cretainly isn't professional grade, but it works great for stuff around the house (I use it to work on old video game carts).
customer_reviews.author: HaVoK

customer_reviews.title: Fast heat up, works for quick small tasks
customer_reviews.text: Needed a quick simple soldering iron. This thing has little dial temp controller, heats up quickly. It's really light weight and comes with number of tips, a tweezers, solder remover that works pretty well, and small tube of solder. The holder is simple aluminum but does well keeping it from tipping over. I have used it about dozen times and no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Seems decent, good package for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My old iron died after 6 years of abuse and I was already considering an upgrade so I went with this unit. For the price you get alot of stuff with it, and temp control works nice. Changing the tip I noticed the ceramic core goes all the way up into the tip so it heats up VERY fast. Like I said last iron lived for 6 years so let's hope this one gives me another 6!
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: It's simple and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very simple setup but I don't mean that in a negative way whatsoever since it works perfectly and helped me get resolder some wires to get a toy working again for the son. It's very easy to hold and use with a nice selection of tips for different tasks. This is a replacement for a more expensive kit from another vendor that had all sorts of bells and whistles but couldn't melt a standard rosin core solder to save its life. Simple is often better so thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Variable Heat makes this one great
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time you will find that sometimes soldering iron that you buy locally just does not get hot enough to melt or take away soldering. This one was great. I had to solder a guitar and it was able to take away old solder and I was able to add new solder with ease. The tools that you get in the kit are great. I have never seen so many in a kit.
customer_reviews.author: cat9

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Good value, get the whole kit giving you versatility. Would like finer temperature control and a few more lights indicating temperature range, and a better stand would be nice. But I am lucky if I solder something every two years so was looking to go cheap. Cant complaine at the price, but would go better if was using on more regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Bjmarks

customer_reviews.title: No manual with temperature suggestions
customer_reviews.text: Dislike that a good manual (including temperature suggestions) is not included. For a novice jewelry maker these things are important. Step by step setup and use directions should be included along with temperature settings for different kinds of materials. Those of us just starting jewelry making need this guidance information!
customer_reviews.author: Anna M. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great value & all the solder accessories you need.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to replace two other single temperature soldering irons that were over 30 years old. The temperature gauge is a little small but very workable. Use this new soldering iron to modify game boy Xbox and other gaming systems PC boards and batteries. The solder sucker comes with worked great!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: For the occasional repair, can’t beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Im a novice when it comes to soldering, but overall I feel this was well worth the money. The only annoyance is the tilt sensor, the iron will only turn on fully when it’s being held vertically, even a slight angle and you can notice the loss of heat. I assume this is a typical safety mechanism, however it seems to be extreme considering to maintain constant heat you would have to be soldering with the iron vertical. Took a little before I figured that one out, so I almost thought the iron wasn’t working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Mirage

customer_reviews.title: I also like the extra nibs and the extra solder
customer_reviews.text: I had to change out some capacitors from a 72" plasma television before donating it to a school, and the soldering iron did it's job very well especially with the heat. The other two soldering irons I have were just not getting the heat out properly. I also like the extra nibs and the extra solder, but all i needed was just the basic nib already attached and I already have my own solder for the job. I tried using the pump, i'm sure it works but it was just too big for the project I was using it on. I was pleasantly surprised with this kit on how well it is for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: D3LUS10N

customer_reviews.title: unfortunately I feel like it doesn't get hot enough
customer_reviews.text: it's a good learner and or if you're not too big in the soldering but need to solder some stuff this would do the job, I feel like it doesn't get hot enough that when you touch the solder to it you have to let it sit there for a second before it melts which isn't too bad
customer_reviews.author: TiedStatistic

customer_reviews.title: Quick Work
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know I needed a new soldering iron until I spent all afternoon trying to solder some wires with my old one. This one came in a hurry and I put it right to use . It was a quality operation, quick work making a perfect connection. I was a happy craftsman. As of now I heartily recommend this tool A plus was the great price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Fehring

customer_reviews.title: Bad temp control
customer_reviews.text: This soldering iron temperature control does not work, at least not on my unit. I just fired up yesterday to do some desoldering and it worked really nice.... it was really quick to heat up. that made me suspicious. Took a thermocouple and applied to the tip, and at the 200C setting, the temperature did not stabilize until ~550C. Waaaay too much. I was not expecting 200C exact but a bit closer to the setting. Thought the dial might be backwards, so I tried moving all the way to the other side to the 450C setting, and the result was the same ~550C. Beware.... $20 for a temperature control soldering iron.... was too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it gets plenty hot. the dial on it it's such a small dial it seems a little hard to tune. I'm haven't done any real fine soldering all pretty easy stuff so far. Would be nice to have a better stand to set it on the one they give you is really really cheap
customer_reviews.author: Jason W Hammack

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: Nice small and inexpensive soldering iron. Some day I will have to confront the issue of replacement tips. This is i no way the equal of a 60W Weller temperature-controlled iron but for occasional home use it works great.
customer_reviews.author: wild bill

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner tool
customer_reviews.text: This soldering iron kit is perfect if you are just starting to solder. It comes with all the necessary tools to begin learning how to use the tool. If you solder more on a regular basis than I would suggest something with better quality parts.
customer_reviews.author: Niram

customer_reviews.title: Great little solder kit for general soldering
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make custom keyboard cables. My expensive soldering iron kicked the bucket and I didn't want to spend another $200 on a new one. I found this little guy and figured I'd give it a try. I was happy with the amount of tools that are included with this iron. Comes with pretty much everything you need to get started soldering. Works great for making cables and soldering connectors. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Nice For Minor Repairs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a soldering iron to repair a battery holder connection to a circuit board. This did the trick. Nice having a temperature control to avoid overheating insulation. This nice kit includes enough solder and a solder removal vacuum so I didn't have to buy anything extra to make the repair.
customer_reviews.author: JP KazarianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very nice soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best soldering iron I have ever had in my 82 years. It heats quickly and the tip stays clean without a lot of tinning and wiping on a sponge. Highly recommended for at least light to medium duty soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a an Amateur Extra radio operator and use this for soldering wires, components, COAX, etc. Works great though you should go to Harbor Freight or another supplier and pick up a regular soldering pencil stand.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: For the price you can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: I don't do a ton of soldering, but enough to need an upgrade from my cheap RadioShack branded one. This one was less expensive and does a better job with temp control and with the variety of tips, etc. make this versatile. Bonus that it comes with an entire kit of useful tools. If you are looking to get into soldering or are a pro that wants a portable version, then this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Apart from the comments I made upon rcpt of this; i.e. temp control in Celsius, etc, the unit operates well; heats reasonably quickly and did the job, I set out to do. I think the unit is worthwhile. The temp control worked fine, the low rating was because the temp control was in Celsius and doesn't show equivalent wattage.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine A. Manfredi

customer_reviews.title: Vastar Soldering Iron Kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, works as described, all the pieces required for a solder starter kit are included. Only thing is there could have been better instructions but easily figured out with youtube videos.
customer_reviews.author: Velo

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I had never soldered before and decided I would get this kit. It brought everything I needed and it even brought its own solder and extra tips for the iron. There is a lot of people that would say that I shouldn’t be working with this iron but honestly it’s really good and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Edwardt S.

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: The packaging states that the Soldering Iron is a 3 Wire Grounder Soldering. It is only 2 Wire without separate Ground. Description noted "Special Steel Tips" Works OK but I have only ever seen Copper Tips on a soldering Iron.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H

customer_reviews.title: Great kit and can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed to solder two small wires and it's been years. My old iron was trashed decades ago. This came with all you need for the occasional use. I did my small project and put this away for another time. Very hand for a DIY person who just needs a basic kit.
customer_reviews.author: RJackson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little kit for tiny soldering needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed to do some small item soldering but only had a big gun. This kit met my needs. Plenty of different, easy to exchange tips, a nice supply of solder in easy to dispense package, iron heats up fairly quickly. Relatively inexpensive. Nice to have around for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Hubbling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools for the hobbiest
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is this kit was well worth the price. The soldering iron works very well; I like the fact that it has a temperature control on it, unlike some other tools I've used. Heats up quickly and stays warm (although I don't use a sponge, but a wire cleaner instead) You also get plenty of solder, and several different tips (but the main tip is pretty flexible). Overall, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D Russo

customer_reviews.title: works for microsoldering
customer_reviews.text: Enabled me to extend the useful life of my patio deck solar lights, so I could de-solder the soldered-in original, exhausted rechargeable batteries and add a battery clip with a new (and better) battery to each.
customer_reviews.author: Secular Hedonist

customer_reviews.title: What you should expect
customer_reviews.text: This Soldering Iron is extremely cheap... but it does everything it needs to do! I had a few wiring projects I needed to do on my truck and this did the job. My soldering wasn't great but I think that was because of my lack of skills rather than lack of quality in the Iron. I seriously doubt that the temperature control is anywhere near accurate, but I don't really care because it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend, good product
customer_reviews.text: Great soldering iron for what I need it for. The extra tips are also nice however I haven’t needed to use them all yet. The only thing I would say that needs an upgrade is the solder that comes with the pack. That’s the only downside I’ve found. Variable temp works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Tesha Wrotenbery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Soldering Iron for price and very easy for beginners
customer_reviews.text: All around good product with good accessory choice. Only downfall in my mind is the metal stand tends to flip and move quite a bit. Id would prefer a small sticky tab on bottom of metal tab stand for stability or tape it to the table.
customer_reviews.author: Deuce

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, and much better than my old iron from Radio Shack. It heats up in under a minute, comes with a variety of tips, and has enough energy to solder large DC and RF connectors and such.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Behr

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit for novices like me
customer_reviews.text: This was my first soldering kit used to in my first attempt to solder a new guitar pick up and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: FJK1138

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use this for small wiring jobs or extending LED strip lights. I love the adjustable temperature feature. It comes with everything you need to start soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome budget solder!
customer_reviews.text: Needs instructions to be clearer for the temperature dial, I wasn't sure what was going on because my kid didn't come with instructions, so tip of the soder is a bit burnt. but its stil a solid solder! ;D
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bolanos

customer_reviews.title: Yarn has an extreme temperature is in 400 degrees and it'll burn you before you know it
customer_reviews.text: iron heats up very quickly it gets very hot and don't let it touch you to stand that holds it is kind of flimsy and it's kind of issue I wouldn't leave it under unattended
customer_reviews.author: Perhdro

customer_reviews.title: Don't use on a regular extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The temperature control is very handy. If you have trouble with it heating, plug it directly into an outlet or use a very heavy duty extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, poor design
customer_reviews.text: The solder pump easily splits in to pieces when in use. Its action is weak. Forceps bends. Iron feels a little flimsy. Solder case was open and solder was in a knot outside of the case. The package likely was previously opened
customer_reviews.author: julianrz

customer_reviews.title: Nice soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: New to soldering so I got this kit. Works great. the temperature dial on it moves sometimes but it's not big deal. The solder sucker it comes with works pretty good and since I'm a new at this I've used it several times when I make mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: lydia fulkerson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Soldering Iron
customer_reviews.text: This soldering iron could not get above 300F even with the temperature control maxed out to 450F. Temperature was taken with a Fluke digital IR thermometer. My old soldering iron got to 478F. I may have got a defective unit. Really not usable.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Bucket

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to desolder
customer_reviews.text: I went cheap & got cheap. It solders but removing solder has been impossible. Maybe the one I got was defective but if I had it to do over again I would have paid for a better soldering tool.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda L Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price, having mulitple tip options is a HUGE plus as I needed these to solder small electrical joints and also solder some HUGE connectors. The solder sucker works great, and this is the kit to buy for a novice when it comes to soldering.
customer_reviews.author: Ben K

customer_reviews.title: not a bad lil iron
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the iron so far, works great, nice selection of tips.. the lil stand is a joke, but the rest of the kit makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Random

customer_reviews.title: Great iron for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This iron heats up quickly! much faster than previous ones I have used. The body is a bit thin, so if you have bigger hands like me, it might feel a bit small. The strain relief did pop out ofthe end atone point but it went right back in. The solder sucker worked well and is pretty light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Caffray

customer_reviews.title: Awesome budget option
customer_reviews.text: I'm not experienced enough to know how a "good" soldering iron should perform , but for soldering wires together and Ebike controller circuit boards , this has been perfect for my uses. It's comfortable to use and gets plenty hot . I measured 403°C on the highest setting with an Etekcity IR thermometer , for whatever that's worth . I ordered a cheap $12 stand to go with it and it's more than functional enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price but the temperature gage is off.
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit, it's probably my fault for assuming a product so cheap would be flawless. However, incorrect temperature output is a major flaw. The lowest setting of 200°C consistently was around 250°C.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have had several, but seem to have legs, they just disappear. Find the others some day, I use heck out of them during Xmas.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Works well on circuit board repair.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to allow repair and replacement of a stepper motor on a GM instrument cluster. It worked great for my application. I won't be using it on a daily basis but for my type of use it is an excellent choice and appears to be a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: I used this iron to fix the poly wicker on my patio chairs. It worked perfectly for why I needed it to do. The different tips were easy to switch out and the iron stayed a nice steady temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for My Purposes
customer_reviews.text: I am new at soldering and as such am only doing through hole soldering. The iron comes with a few heads that seem good to me, and the dial for the temp work well enough. The included stand is a little odd to use but it does do its job. I have used this iron for 2 projects and everything seems fine to me. It seems like a good cheaper option. I would get different solder as the one that comes with it is leaded
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs great and the accessories are suitable for any size job
customer_reviews.text: This solder iron has worked great for both large and small jobs. I love having different tip sizes depending on what I'm doing. The smallest tip works great for small gauge wire and soldering on a circuit boards, while the larger tips have been great when splicing larger gauge wire. So far this has more than met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT TOOL!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! This tool is amazing...this was was my first experience in using an soldering gun and im still learning but its perfect....I highly recommend purchasing one. I was unclear about what the tool was with what seems like some pump action is required but other than that BRAVO👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS TRIBBLE

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great I had a few touch ups to do on my keyless entry remote that repair paid for it on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Flogel

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The item was just as purchased and my family member who will be using it is very pleased. I would recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Vican

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Did what I needed, the tip likely will not last a long time, but hard to beat the price for occasional use. Also the tweezers are really helpful, careful though, I almost threw them away as they were hidden in the package pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: JPod

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: Great Kit, I've seen similar kits with a little more stuff and a little cheaper, cannot tell about the quality. This Kit seems to work so far as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: works just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this and tried it out the first time it didn't seem to heat up enough. But I tried it again a couple of days ago and it works great. Plenty of heat to do all of my soldering needs for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bushido

customer_reviews.title: Excellent set up flexibility
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron to weld a HDPE gas tank. Because of the various tips and adjustable heat settings I was able to use different set-ups for different geometries and thicknesses of the materials. I am very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H Garnes

customer_reviews.title: A great find
customer_reviews.text: I am completely happy with this little solder iron. Comfortable in the hand, easy to use. Buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Washburne

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for melting holes in plastic and other diy projects, it works so great. Really good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool! It heats up rapidly & it is small enough that it is easy to hold &use. The heat temperature dial is also a plus because it is easy to dial the temperature you need so not to get too hot for the job you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Rebbecca Robinson

customer_reviews.title: excellent little kit
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice little kit with a nice assortment of tips, solder etc., excellent price...definitely would purchase another one if I need too!!
customer_reviews.author: probie302

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed, no frills.
customer_reviews.text: My 1975 Stereo was crackling and I sorted it out. This was all I needed to pull the transistors and re-solder the 10 connections. Pre-tinned tips, solder sucker, good solder. Only thing else I needed was some locking forceps to pull them, and I had that in my first- aid kit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Well
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at how well this soldier iron is doing its job. Heats up fast, gets to job done, and doesn't fall apart after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: traves

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cheap! I don’t need a soldering iron very often, but this worked well for a small electronics project I had been meaning to finish for a long time. Heats up well, maintains the temperature fairly well. The holder is a cheap piece of metal, I nailed it down to a piece of scrap plywood, and that seems to work well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: So small and very easy to use. Excellent price and works perfectly, love the temperature control dial.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone trying to decide if to buy this product or not, don't think about it twice the reviews speak for itself!!! I never used a soldering iron before but after watching some YouTube videos and practicing I was able to do some work. Very easy to use and comes with all the tools as shown in the description. I would highly recommend getting this. Hope this helps a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Patience and the proper Tools .
customer_reviews.text: This solder set looks good for the job I purchased it for but have not got around to finish the job yet . Update when I git er done .
customer_reviews.author: geeman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had some micro soldering to do on a drone. The various tip sizes were perfect. The adjustable temp control is a huge plus when dealing with tiny boards and connections. This comes with a few extras that help as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value So Far
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far but seemed to work fine - other items were there as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I fixed my headphones’ wire using this soldering iron without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: 2/3rd

customer_reviews.title: Okay to use for wielding needs, but not for sex doll repairs.
customer_reviews.text: If you ever need to use a soldering iron to repair life size TPE sex dolls, don't use this product unless you're a professional who knows what to do. I purchased the soldering iron to repair the TPE material of my doll, but I ended up increasing the damage. Now I have to buy a new one. Thats sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: This item is garbage. Save your money and buy one at Walmart. Sporadic temperature control. Cheap construction. Wiring harness connecting power cord to device fell out during first use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I started using this to solder circuit boards and wiring. The fine soldering point and solder work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MrThink

customer_reviews.title: SOLDERINGI RON
customer_reviews.text: iT CAME ONT TIME AND LOOKS OF GOOD QUALITY. HAVE NOT OPENED 0R USED.
customer_reviews.author: rahvatech

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: 3-4 min warm up soldered electrical harnesses and did some repair work on stained glass window. Worked fine
customer_reviews.author: keith bleier

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Nice low-cost purchase but works exactly as expected. Still trying to figure out why I've been buying big units when this package works just fine for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: Seems to Work as Specified
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it much but it seems to work. Temp control works. Feels comfortable. Good accessories included (for occasional use) Not really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and works well
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cant go wrong. Nice quality and works well. Heats up in just a few minutes and is easy to set the temp your looking for. Perfect for the hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Wright

customer_reviews.title: Heats up quickly and comes with good tips
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid, fast-heating soldering pen that comes with a nice assortment of tips and has an adjustable temperature dial. A somewhat dim red LED shows that it is on, but does not tell you when the iron is up to heat - but as I said already, it heats quickly. Swapping tips out is super easy since it uses a tightening ring instead of the common screw type fastener, and the cord is nice and pliable. Overall pretty happy with the purchase, though I've not had great luck with the solder remover on the small contacts I'm working with.
customer_reviews.author: MMO

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my dad, and he uses it quite often with no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This product belongs in the garbage pail.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 1 star because 0 stars is not an option. This product is junk. Doesn’t heat right. Soldering tips go bad after 1 or 2 uses. When I changed soldering tip, it fails after one use and to make matters worse, it became jamed in the holder. Useless garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Krasney

product_meta.title: Vastar Soldering Iron Kit, Full Set 60W 110V Soldering Welding Iron Kit - Adjustable Temperature, 5pcs Different Tips, Desoldering Pump, Stand, Anti-static Tweezers and Additional Solder Tube
feature_bullets: ✔ Heat up Quickly and Heat Dissipation Efficiency - Better heat dissipation efficiency with our upgrade steel-pipe design, the vaster new soldering iron is more efficient in a better heat dissipation.
✔ Upgrade PCBA - we use the chip fixed resistor while others on the market use the color ring resistance, the chip fixed resistor will help the soldering well.
✔ Excellent Soldering Gun - No need soldering station, just plug and play. Easy to operation.Adjust the temperature according to your need by the knob wheel on the electronic soldering iron.
✔ 5 Pcs Iron Tips - Five different tips makes soldering iron easy to fit for guitar, computers, hardware, and TV capacitors or accessories etc.
✔ Widely Used Soldering kits - Soldering iron welding tools is widely used for welding circuit board, appliance repair, Home DIY hobbyists, jewelry welding. Best choice for Welding beginner.
